intro: Pithecellobium incuriale var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered pithecellobium, is a species native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its compound leaves and clustered flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in coastal areas or lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
